comments:
This just seems to happen (over and over again).  I can't associate it with any particular action I'm taking.

-- Error Log --
Date: Wed Apr 11 17:28:31 EDT 2007
Message: An internal error occurred during: "Metadata refresh".
Severity: Error
Plugin ID: org.eclipse.core.jobs
Stack Trace:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Not supported: indent-number
	at org.apache.xalan.processor.TransformerFactoryImpl.setAttribute(TransformerFactoryImpl.java:608)
	at org.eclipse.buckminster.sax.Utils.createTransformerHandler(Utils.java:285)
	at org.eclipse.buckminster.sax.Utils.newSerializer(Utils.java:182)
	at org.eclipse.buckminster.sax.Utils.serializeUgly(Utils.java:265)
	at org.eclipse.buckminster.sax.Utils.getImage(Utils.java:135)
	at org.eclipse.buckminster.core.metadata.model.UUIDKeyed.getId(UUIDKeyed.java:131)
	at org.eclipse.buckminster.core.metadata.model.Resolution.<init>(Resolution.java:100)
	at org.eclipse.buckminster.pde.internal.PDEBuilder.build(PDEBuilder.java:94)
	at org.eclipse.buckminster.core.resolver.LocalResolver.fromPath(LocalResolver.java:463)
	at org.eclipse.buckminster.core.metadata.MetadataSynchronizer.refreshProject(MetadataSynchronizer.java:308)
	at org.eclipse.buckminster.core.metadata.MetadataSynchronizer$MetadataRefreshJob.run(MetadataSynchronizer.java:167)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

It seems your setup is configured to use a org.xml.sax implementation that doesn't support some of the standard properties. What JVM are you using? Do you have some special (and old) xerces implementation in your setup?

I just moved from 3.2.2 to 3.3M6, but didn't change the JVM I use (which is a relatively recent version).  I don't believe I have any other xerces implementations on that machine.

c:\workspaces>java -version
java version "1.5.0"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build pwi32dev-20070201 (SR4))
IBM J9 VM (build 2.3, J2RE 1.5.0 IBM J9 2.3 Windows XP x86-32 j9vmwi3223-20070201 (JIT enabled)
J9VM - 20070131_11312_lHdSMR
JIT  - 20070109_1805ifx1_r8
GC   - 200701_09)
JCL  - 20070131

c:\workspaces>

It's the IBM JVM that's causing the problem. Apparently it's equipped with less competent sax package then the Sun, JRockit, etc.

I'll try and fix this. The least the Buckminster serializer could do is to ignore the exception and skip the indents altogether.
Added try/catch around the indent-number setting since it's not fatal if it doesn't succeed.
I moved to 3.3M7 and haven't seen the error.

I was too quick.  It just happened again, exactly the same stack trace.  Below is the session data:

Buckminster for Europa M7 has not yet been released. It's scheduled for May 22.
That would explain it.  I thought I saw that this bug had been fixed in 3.3M7...and just assumed it was included.
The version found at the Europa staging site should no longer have this problem. Try using http://download.eclipse.org/releases/europa/staging in the update manager.
